title: Dropout isn't working with fp16 on 1.0.0.dev20181006
body_html:
🐛 Bug

Using dropout with either cpu or cuda HalfTensor throws an error:

RuntimeError: bernoulli_ is not implemented for type torch.HalfTensor

or

RuntimeError: "bernoulli_scalar_cuda_" not implemented for 'torch.cuda.HalfTensor'

This wasn't the case for version 0.4.1

To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:

  1. Apply dropout (1d, 2d, 3d) on a fp16 input, either cpu or cuda.
x = torch.ones(1, 1, 3, 3).half()

print(F.dropout2d(x)) # Works on v0.4.1
print(F.dropout2d(x.cuda())) # Works on v0.4.1

Expected behavior

The code above works on PyTorch version 0.4.1, but it fails on version 1.0.0.dev20181006 with the error:
RuntimeError: bernoulli_ is not implemented for type torch.HalfTensor
RuntimeError: "bernoulli_scalar_cuda_" not implemented for 'torch.cuda.HalfTensor'
